Why should I do a master in design? I am not particularly interested in design. Typography, craft, layouting, projecting, all of these are completely collateral to what I am actually interested in. The Sandburg looks like an interesting place and one that discusses subjects I'm interested in, but I am dangerously bored by concerning myself with how to present those subjects. There is no commercialism in it, which is a good point, but will it be just pseudo intellectuality and fancy excuses to show pretty things that follow a sort of new ugly avantgarde aesthetic?

So why design? I do not know . It could be a good bridge to other things, it could allow me to meet people who can further my practice and help me with the bits that bore me so.

What will happen after the Sandburg I don't know as well. Pippo says I'm going to become an artist, that what I do is already art (not necessarily good art) and he might be right. But how to deal with the not wanting to belong? I do not want to be an artist (I start to be convinced that that concept is a bit foolish and silly, that it reduces a practice and research and meaning to some sort of silly concept full of aura (Frankfurtâ€™s aura).

I guess that might be why I chose to go with it, to actually spend money and etc to do a masters in something I'm only borderline interested. It allows me to sort of remain an outsider it can be a very bad strategic decision akin to professional suicide , but we'll see.
